Detailed Description

PKI Support.

Define Documentation

#define READCORRECT ( cnt,
node,
value,
addr   ) 
Value:
{cnt = 0;   \
    while (value >= (1ull << 48) && cnt++ < 20) \
        value = cvmx_read_csr_node(node, addr); \
    if (cnt >= 20)  \
        cvmx_dprintf("count stuck for 0x%llx\n", (long long unsigned int)addr); }

Function Documentation

void __cvmx_pki_free_ptr ( int  node  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

This function is called by cvmx_helper_shutdown() to extract all FPA buffers out of the PKI. After this function completes, all FPA buffers that were prefetched by PKI will be in the apropriate FPA pool. This functions does not reset PKI. WARNING: It is very important that PKI be reset soon after a call to this function.

uint64_t  port 
)

Clear the statistics counters for a port.

Parameters:

port Port number (ipd_port) to get statistics for. Make sure PKI_STATS_CTL:mode is set to 0 for collecting per port/pkind stats.

int cvmx_pki_enable_aura_qos ( int  node,
int  aura,
bool  ena_red,
bool  ena_drop,
bool  ena_bp 
)

Enables/Disabled QoS (RED Drop, Tail Drop & backpressure) for the PKI aura.

Enables/Disabled QoS (RED Drop, Tail Drop & backpressure) for the* PKI aura.

Parameters:
node Node number
aura To enable/disable QoS on.
ena_red Enable/Disable RED drop between pass and drop level 1-enable 0-disable
ena_drop Enable/disable tail drop when max drop level exceeds 1-enable 0-disable
ena_bp Enable/Disable asserting backpressure on bpid when max DROP level exceeds. 1-enable 0-disable
void cvmx_pki_endis_fcs_check ( int  node,
int  pknd,
bool  fcs_chk,
bool  fcs_strip 
)

Enables/Disables fcs check and fcs stripping on the pkind.

Parameters:
node Node number
pknd PKIND to apply settings on.
fcs_chk Enable/disable fcs check. 1 = enable fcs error check. 0 = disable fcs error check.
fcs_strip Strip L2 FCS bytes from packet, decrease WQE[LEN] by 4 bytes 1 = strip L2 FCS. 0 = Do not strip L2 FCS.

int cvmx_pki_read_pkind_config ( int  node,
int  pkind,
struct cvmx_pki_pkind_config *  pkind_cfg 
)

This function reads per pkind parameters in hardware which defines how the incoming packet is processed.

Parameters:
node Node number.
pkind PKI supports a large number of incoming interfaces and packets arriving on different interfaces or channels may want to be processed differently. PKI uses the pkind to determine how the incoming packet is processed.
pkind_cfg Pointer to struct conatining pkind configuration read from the hardware.

void cvmx_pki_reset ( int  node  ) 

This function soft resets PKI.

Parameters:
node Node to enable PKI.
void cvmx_pki_set_little_endian ( int  node,
uint64_t  style 
)

This function sets the Packet mode of all ports and styles to little-endian.

It Changes write operations of packet data to L2C to be in little-endian. Does not change the WQE header format, which is properly endian neutral.

Parameters:
node Node number.
style Style to configure.
void cvmx_pki_set_wqe_mode ( int  node,
uint64_t  style,
bool  pkt_outside_wqe 
)

This function sets the wqe buffer mode.

First packet data buffer can reside either in same buffer as wqe OR it can go in separate buffer. If used the later mode, make sure software allocate enough buffers to now have wqe separate from packet data.

Parameters:
node Node number.
style Style to configure.
pkt_outside_wqe 0 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] immediately followed by packet data, in the same buffer as the work queue entry. 1 = The packet link pointer will be at word [FIRST_SKIP] in a new buffer separate from the work queue entry. Words following the WQE in the same cache line will be zeroed, other lines in the buffer will not be modified and will retain stale data (from the buffers previous use). This setting may decrease the peak PKI performance by up to half on small packets.
int cvmx_pki_setup_clusters ( int  node  )

int cvmx_pki_write_aura_bpid ( int  node,
int  aura,
int  bpid 
)

Configures the bpid on which, specified aura will assert backpressure.

Configures the bpid on which, specified channel will assert backpressure.

Each bpid receives backpressure from auras. Multiple auras can backpressure single bpid.

Parameters:
node Node number.
aura Number which will assert backpressure on that bpid.
bpid To assert backpressure on.
int cvmx_pki_write_channel_bpid ( int  node,
int  channel,
int  bpid 
)

Configures the channel which will receive backpressure from the specified bpid.

Each channel listens for backpressure on a specific bpid. Each bpid can backpressure multiple channels.

Parameters:
node Node number.
bpid BPID from which, channel will receive backpressure.
channel Channel number to receive backpressue.
static void cvmx_pki_write_frame_len ( int  node,
int  id,
struct cvmx_pki_frame_len  len_chk 
) [static]

This function writes max and min frame lengths to hardware which can be used to check the size of frame arrived.There are 2 possible combination which are indicated by id field.

Parameters:
node Node number.
id Choose which frame len register to write to
len_chk Struct containing byte count for max-sized/min-sized frame check.

)

struct cvmx_pki_pkind_config *  pkind_cfg 
)

This function writes per pkind parameters in hardware which defines how the incoming packet is processed.

Parameters:
node Node number.
pkind PKI supports a large number of incoming interfaces and packets arriving on different interfaces or channels may want to be processed differently. PKI uses the pkind to determine how the incoming packet is processed.
pkind_cfg Pointer to struct conatining pkind configuration need to be written in the hardware.

void cvmx_pki_write_tag_config ( int  node,
int  style,
uint64_t  cluster_mask,
struct cvmx_pki_style_tag_cfg *  tag_cfg 
)

This function writes/configures parameters associated with tag configuration in hardware.

In Custom-Mask Tagging, all four masks use the same base index to access Tag Control and Tag Mask registers.

Parameters:
node Node number.
style Style to configure tag for.
cluster_mask Mask of clusters to configure the style for.
tag_cfg Pointer to taf configuration struct.
